text: Spencer Ferguson Silver III (February 6, 1941May 8, 2021) was an American chemist and inventor. He co-invented Post-it Notes with Arthur Fry. Silver died at his home in St. Paul, Minnesota on May 8, 2021, from ventricular tachycardia.
